item.title: Roblox: Evolve Clash Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Despite being a Tower Defense game, Evolve Clash has a unique gameplay style. Instead of following a set path, enemies spawn and move randomly. This requires a variety of units. Luckily, there's an easy way to get them using Evolve Clash codes.

These Roblox codes grant players various free perks from the developers. Among them, you'll find significant amounts of Crystals. Even a few of these will be enough to summon 10 units, even from the very beginning of the game.

All Evolve Clash Codes

Working Evolve Clash Codes

  • Damage – Redeem this code to get 250 Crystals
  • Release – Redeem this code to get 250 Crystals

Expired Evolve Clash Codes

  • OmgLucky
  • Beta

Each stage in Evolve Clash contains various enemies that spawn in succession. They spawn in various locations and are often quite far apart from each other. Because of this, you'll want to build a team with a variety of units, including ranged ones. Characters can be summoned in the appropriate area of ​​the lobby in exchange for Crystals. To earn this currency faster, we recommend using Evolve Clash codes.

These Roblox codes can significantly speed up your gameplay. Most contain up to 250 Crystals, which is especially useful for expanding your unit collection. However, it's worth noting that after release, each code expires and becomes unavailable. So, you shouldn't delay redeeming them for too long.

How to Redeem Evolve Clash Codes

Using Evolve Clash codes takes just a few clicks. This feature works just as easily as in most other Roblox experiences. But for convenience, you can follow these simple steps:

  • First, launch the Evolve Clash experience.
  • Next, click the More button and select the Rewards option.
  • Then enter the code in the appropriate field.
  • After that, click the Redeem button to claim all your free goodies.
  • Note that Roblox is case-sensitive, so you should copy and paste the codes instead of entering them manually. This way, you'll avoid typos and be sure to claim your rewards.

How to Get More Evolve Clash Codes

To avoid missing Evolve Clash codes, we recommend you bookmark this guide. We'll update it over time, along with our other Roblox articles. Alternatively, players can check the developers' official social media pages, where they post all the latest news about the game. You'll find all the codes there as soon as they're released:

  • Official Adyssey Studio Discord Server
  • Official Adyssey Studio Roblox Group
  • Official Adyssey Studio X Page

8.8 /10

item.title: 7 Reasons Why GTA Is The Most Important Franchise In Gaming
item.description:
Grand Theft Auto is one of the most popular gaming franchises of all time; there's no denying that. The sheer amount of hype generated by GTA 6 's release is making this clear as day.

The impact of each GTA game on the gaming industry is undeniable, to the point where most people consider Grand Theft Auto to be one of the most important gaming franchises of all time. It's a hard statement to dispute, especially when the facts are highlighted.

Laid The Foundation For The Open-World Genre

GTA 3 Was A Groundbreaking Title For This Very Reason

The first two Grand Theft Auto games were decent in their own right, but it wasn't until the release of Grand Theft Auto 3 that this franchise took off. The game's open world was off the charts and so immersive that players could lose themselves in the streets of Liberty City for hours on end.

The sheer impact this game had on the industry can't be stated enough. Fans salivated at the prospect of playing an open-world game ever since this title's release, turning this genre into one of the most popular ones in gaming that every developer tries to nail in some form or another.

Publishers Quake In Their Boots Around The Time Of Any GTA's Release

Imagine The Silksong Effect But On A Much Larger Scale

Grand Theft Auto 6 is a game that every publisher is fearing right now. Releasing any game around the same time will be nothing short of career suicide for the devs who don't want their hard work to be ignored.

There's a reason why GTA 6 's delay freed up this year for more releases while forcing publishers to avoid May 2026 entirely. Imagine Hollow Knight: Silksong 's impact but on a far grander scale — that's precisely how GTA influences the industry with a mere announcement.

The Entire Franchise Has Sold Almost 500 Million Copies Combined

Doubly Impressive Considering The Wait Between Releases For Modern Games

One common thing people will notice in the list of the top-selling video game franchises is how most of these games prioritize annual releases. This isn't the case with Grand Theft Auto , and the wait between the fifth and sixth mainline entry makes this clear as day.

So, it's genuinely impressive that GTA is one of the best-selling video game franchises of all time, having sold more than 450 million copies combined. It shows the huge pull this franchise has, to the point where a single game from the series has sold upwards of 100 million units by its lonesome.

Every Release Heightens The Standards Of Open-World Gaming

Fans Expect More And More From The Open-World Genre With Each Successive Release

Grand Theft Auto 3 established the foundation of the modern open-world genre, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas showed the importance of scope in a sandbox game, and Grand Theft Auto 5 's technical performance pushed the standards of open-world gaming to new heights.

This is a common theme with the GTA games, to the point where most big-budget AAA open-world games are inevitably compared to Grand Theft Auto . It's the gold standard of the genre and will continue to be so with Rockstar's competence at the helm.

The Cultural Influence Of This Franchise Is Unmatched

The Memes Are A Great Example Of This

Grand Theft Auto has influenced pop culture in ways that fans are well aware of. San Andreas itself is a hub of memes and iconic moments that make it infinitely quotable to this day.

Roman's bowling became hilarious in its own right, as did Lamar's iconic rant in Grand Theft Auto 5 . The release date of Grand Theft Auto 6 has been so elusive that it has become a meme in its own right, further hammering in the cultural impact this series has had ever since GTA 3 blew up.

GTA Online's Rampant Popularity Speaks For Itself

One Of The Biggest Multiplayer Game Modes Of All Time

Rockstar was already king of the single-player genre, but they decided to try their hand at multiplayer with GTA Online . It didn't have the most promising start, but Rockstar ensured that they'd continually add a ton of content to this experience over the course of its run.

Fixing server issues and jam-packing the game with content ensured that GTA Online would become one of the most popular multiplayer modes in gaming history. It single-handedly turned GTA 5 into Rockstar's focus for almost a decade, much to the chagrin of GTA 6 fans who wanted to get their hands on this title sooner rather than later.

The Attention To Detail Present In These Games Is Unparalleled

Every GTA Game Is Jam-Packed With Polished Details

One of the biggest strengths of Rockstar is its incredible attention to detail, something that is personified in the GTA series. The 3D games were arcade-y in their own right, but a deluge of easter eggs and the intricate simulations present in San Andreas made it clear that Rockstar wanted to be at the forefront of the gaming industry in terms of technical excellence.

Grand Theft Auto 4 took things in a realistic direction, something that was cemented in the next mainline entry. From NPC behavior to the sheer amount of detail packed in the open world, it's easy to see why all these details pile up to make every GTA game a blast to play through.

item.title: Best Games Where You Can Have No Regard For Human Life
item.description:
There are some video games where players can play through non-lethally. Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain is a notable example of non-lethal gameplay, as players can subdue enemies with sleeping darts instead of resorting to lethal force. They can even recruit enemies, send them back to HQ, and then use them to create gear.

Astro Bot is another fine example, as each level is filled with random bots to rescue. These are great rescue-type games, but not every player cares about being kind to their fellow man or bot. Some players want to cause chaos as much as possible without thinking of human life. This goes beyond enemies, too, as random NPCs can be in danger. These are the chaotic highlights.

Grand Theft Auto 5

I’m Driving Here!

Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
151
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto 5 , or any Grand Theft Auto game for that matter, puts players in control of sociopaths. They can do anything they want to civilians, and there are consequences. For example, running over a pedestrian can get the cops out, whom players can run from or take on. Even with punishments, players still drive and walk around like crazed animals. It’s part of why this series has gathered such a fanbase ever since Grand Theft Auto 3 was released on the PS2 and revolutionized the open-world sandbox genre.

Prototype

Eat Humans, Be Humans

Prototype
8.8 /10
Released
June 9, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Prototype is one of the most chaotic superhero games to ever release. As Alex Mercer, players are cursed with a virus that gives them morphing abilities. He can sprout wings, run up buildings, turn his arms into blades, and so on. The military wants to cage him, but Mercer is having none of that, so he rebels. Players can eat random humans to regain health and retain their DNA, which can then help disguise Mercer in plain sight. This even works with soldiers to get into bases, and it’s an overall cool albeit diabolical system.

Destroy All Humans!

Invade The Planet

Destroy All Humans!
7 /10
10 /10
Released
July 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Destroy All Humans! is one of the few games out there that puts players in charge of an invading alien: Crypto. He is tasked with enslaving humanity in the 1950s with various methods, from beaming humans up into his spaceship to mind controlling them with brainwaves.

Like Alex Mercer, players can even disguise themselves to sneak around. Players can suck out NPC brains for tasty treats, which is already messed up, along with going on a rampage with Crypto’s spaceship to destroy civilization. Destroy All Humans! is easily accessible today thanks to the remake .

God Of War

All Bow Before Kratos

God of War (2005)
8.7 /10
Released
March 22, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

God of War was an intense game starring a vengeful man named Kratos. While Kratos’ main beef was with the Greek gods, he killed whatever monster or human came across his path. Fans can remember a particular soldier they had to sacrifice via flames to move on. It was unsettling and unjustified, easily making Kratos an unlikable character, and this was just the first game. Thankfully, the 2018 reboot games made Kratos at least redeemable.

Palworld

Gotta Catch All The Humans

Palworld
139
8.6 /10
Released
January 19, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Violence
Powered by

Some players have a problem with the Pokemon series since they don’t think it’s right that Trainers can capture cute critters, Pokemon, to become their battle servants. Those who think that will really have a problem with Palworld , a popular Pokemon clone wherein players can catch monsters and put them to work on hard labor projects.

Even wilder, players can capture humans and then make them their servants. These are full-on humans too, not cyborgs, halflings, or anything like that. It’s pretty messed up, no matter how people feel about the monster-catching aspect.

Katamari Damacy

They See Me Rollin’

Katamari Damacy
Action
Systems
9.0 /10
Released
September 21, 2004
ESRB
E // Mild Fantasy Violence

Powered by

Katamari Damacy is another seemingly cute game with a weird gameplay concept that gets darker the more players engage. As the Prince of the cosmos, players are sent to Earth to gather up random objects to then shoot into space to become stars. Players can roll up tacks, erasers, pens, animals, and even humans. Rolling up any living creature is odd, let alone the fact that these things will be sent into space to become stars. The Prince and his father, the wacky King of all Cosmos, don’t seem to mind, though.

Vampyr

Curate Your Diet

Vampyr
5 /10
8.6 /10
Released
June 5, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Vampyr takes place in the early 1900s and, as the title suggests, centers on vampires. Players are a doctor, Jonathan, who gets bitten by a vampire, but decides to continue being a doctor to help people. Players can play the story nobly by not engaging in bloodlust, but this will make Jonathan weak. Instead, they can still care for their patients, but more in the way a farmer cares for his cattle, in the sense that players can take care of humans to feed off them. The more Jonathan feeds, the stronger he will become, giving players an incentive to be heartless.

item.title: Open-World Games With The Longest Development Time
item.description:
Open-world games are among the most complex productions in the gaming world, demanding expansive environments, systemic interactivity, narrative depth, and technical ambition on a whole new level. While many projects are completed within standard multi-year cycles, certain titles undergo prolonged development, sometimes stretching across a decade or more.

These extended timelines often reflect internal difficulties or evolving levels of scale that make it difficult to pin down a definitive release date.

It might not always be clear why the wait was so long, but many open-world titles were well worth the wait, even if it meant adding a few years to the development cycle.

Dying Light 2

Restart After Restart

Dying Light 2 Stay Human
6.9 /10
Released
February 4, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Techland
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Following the success of the original, Techland aimed to create a larger, more reactive open world with branching storylines, elevated parkour systems, and more player-driven consequences in the world. This ambition, combined with internal restructuring, extended the development of Dying Light 2 far beyond those initial expectations.

The prolonged schedule allowed for technical upgrades and expanded scope, though the team faced challenges balancing that ambition with the actual execution. Ultimately, the additional time allowed the team to deliver a vast urban playground that ticked every box for fans and new players alike.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance

A True Medieval Fantasy

Kingdom Come: Deliverance
10
7.6 /10
Released
February 13, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Warhorse Studios
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Kingdom Come: Deliverance aimed to create a historically accurate open-world RPG set in 15th-century Bohemia. But because of the scope, the project faced delays due to crowdfunding constraints, engine development, and the overall challenge of simulating realistic combat and NPC behavior across a large, explorable map.

With a prolonged development, the team was able to craft a deep, realistic medieval world with intricate quests, realistic social structures, and immersive exploration, and the years of refinement contributed to the game’s attention to detail, making it one of the most authentic open-world RPGs released in the 2010s.

Starfield

Bethesda's Next Long-Term Vision

As Bethesda’s first new major IP in years, Starfield promised everything from procedurally generated planets to the same iconic NPC interactions that made the developer's previous games so iconic. These demands, alongside iterative delays for polish and scale, contributed to the extended timeline.

With technical challenges related to a new engine and the weight on the team's shoulders, delays were to be expected. The wait allowed the game to release in a more finished state and to deliver on the promise of a large-scale space-exploration RPG rather than a rushed failure.

Final Fantasy 15

Reworking A Previously Announced Sequel

Final Fantasy 15
9 /10
8.3 /10
Released
November 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Initially announced under another name, FF15 underwent creative reboots and internal changes before finally emerging as a mainline open-world action-RPG in one of gaming's most beloved franchises. The extended schedule stemmed from an expansion in scope that required more attention than expected over a longer period of time.

In the end, the open-world structure, cinematic storytelling, and expansive world design satisfied most long-time fans, despite making them wait a little longer for a fully realized product.

L.A. Noire

Historical Reconstruction That Demanded Care Beyond The Norm

L.A. Noire
8 /10
9.3 /10
Released
May 17, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Team Bondi
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

L.A. Noire is a remarkable neo-noir thriller set in a faithful reconstruction of a 1940s Los Angeles, which includes a lot of technical innovation that led to an extended development time. The focus on realism required more advanced facial motion capture and engaging gameplay systems, meaning that a standard window quickly extended to many years.

This extended cycle led to a higher level of fidelity across the board and a more cinematic feel that resulted in an open-world experience that captures every expectation and more for a realistic detective narrative.

Cyberpunk 2077

A New Futuristic Epic Years In The Making

Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
123
8.9 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

CD Projekt Red began work on Cyberpunk 2077 soon after The Witcher 3 entered production, with full development starting around 2012. The sheer ambition of crafting a futuristic megacity, alongside engine rewrites, evolving hardware expectations, and team restructures, stretched the schedule beyond the norm, worrying fans and developers alike.

The challenges of building a dense open world filled with quests, systems, and narrative branches proved more taxing than anticipated, and while the launch was rocky due to performance issues, the extended cycle allowed for an unparalleled level of world-building detail, which was steadily realized through patches and updates post-release.

Skull And Bones

Almost Dropping Below Sea Level

Skull and Bones
5 /10
4.6 /10
Released
February 16, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Use of Drugs, Violence
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Singapore
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Weak
Powered by

Originally conceived as a spin-off from Assassin’s Creed IV: Black Flag , Skull and Bones underwent numerous redesigns, shifting from a multiplayer-focused naval experience to a broader open-world pirate simulator. Multiple reboots, management changes, and scope adjustments all contributed to the extended production, which left many feeling as though it would never launch.

The final product faced mixed reviews from players who had waited many years for the launch, but after patches and continued support from the development team, the future looks bright for a game with so much effort and heart behind it.

Kenshi

An RPG Evolution Over 10 Years In The Making

Kenshi
10 /10
Released
December 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Developer(s)
Lo-Fi Games
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Kenshi is a vast open-world sandbox RPG built primarily by a single developer in its initial years. The protracted timeline emerged from the deep system complexity and immersive world-building that demanded a lot more attention from the development team than it could handle.

But over time, the organic growth and community feedback enabled the gameplay to evolve in a more player-focused direction that wouldn't have been possible within more strict constraints. The final product demonstrates how the slow refinement of a single IP can lead to a deeply immersive world that can keep players invested for 100s of hours.

item.title: Dan Houser Confirms No Involvement in GTA 6 Story
item.description:
Rockstar Games co-founder Dan Houser has confirmed that he was not part of the writers' room for Grand Theft Auto 6 . Houser left Rockstar Games over half a decade ago, but many fans wondered whether he contributed to GTA 6 in some capacity before his departure — a question he has now addressed.

Houser, alongside his brother Sam (current president of Rockstar Games), has remained almost entirely out of the public eye since the late 1990s, preferring to let Rockstar's games speak for themselves. Outside rare statements, such as Sam's initial announcement of GTA 6 Trailer 1, the Houser brothers have garnered a reputation for secrecy. However, Dan abruptly exited Rockstar Games in February 2020, which, given his writing credits for 12 GTA games and both Red Dead Redemption titles, bred concerns among some fans.

GTA 6 Does Not Feature Any Trace of Dan Houser

The concerns centered around whether GTA 6 would be as strong on the story and world-building fronts as its predecessors without Houser's involvement. However, since GTA 6 's development timeline suggests pre-production started before Houser left the studio, a lot of fans reckoned he could've contributed his writing chops to the game. That notion was recently debunked by Houser himself during a live in-person interview with IGN. Houser noted that he had written the "last 10 or 11" entries in the franchise and that the world has "had enough GTA " from him. "They're always a new story. It's not going to be a story I wrote or a character set that I developed , but I think it's going to be exciting," he added.

I wrote the last 10 or 11 [GTA games]. I think the world's probably had enough GTA from me. They're always a new story. [GTA 6 is] not going to be a story I wrote or a character set that I developed, but I think it's going to be exciting. The game will be great, I'm sure.

Though Houser admitted it would feel "strange" to play a new GTA game without knowing its full story, he remains confident that GTA 6 "will be great." From both GTA 6 trailers that Rockstar has released so far, the game seems no less potent than prior series entries in weaving a compelling story inside a well-executed parody of the real world. It was also during this interview that Houser spilled the beans on why Bully 2 never happened, stating that Rockstar Games was spread too thin with titles like GTA 5 , Red Dead Redemption , LA Noire , and Max Payne 3 to take on another big project.

GTA 6 is scheduled to launch on May 26, 2026, and it should be interesting to see how well the writing of Rockstar's first new game post Dan Houser's exit holds up. As for Houser himself, he's currently spearheading multiple new creative projects at Absurd Ventures, the multimedia company he founded in 2021. Absurd Ventures recently struck a publishing deal with Smilegate for an upcoming AAA sci-fi open-world action-adventure game that's currently in early development, and the studio is also set to release a new graphic novel dubbed American Caper this November.

Grand Theft Auto 6
